meanings.sent1: The celled organism was made up of tiny units.
meanings.sent2: The plant was celled, with each leaf containing many cells.
meanings.sent3: The celled creature looked like a tiny city under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: Her celled structure resembled a complex puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The celled structure of the tissue was intricate and fascinating.

meanings.sent1: The celled wall separated the rooms in the building.
meanings.sent2: The celled structure of the honeycomb provided individual compartments for the bees.
meanings.sent3: The celled design of the office space allowed for privacy and focus.
meanings.sent4: The celled layout of the prison resembled a maze of confinement.
meanings.sent5: The celled structure of the beehive was a marvel of organization.

meanings.definition: Having a specified number or type of cells
meanings.sent1: The celled battery had a capacity of 5000 mAh.
meanings.sent2: The celled grid had a pattern of squares of equal size.
meanings.sent3: The celled phone case could hold exactly three credit cards.
meanings.sent4: The celled storage container had compartments for different types of screws.
meanings.sent5: The celled panel displayed a precise arrangement of buttons.
